config.question: What caused a critical division within the Republican Party during Jefferson’s presidency?

choices.content: Jefferson’s extensive reforms for federal courts
Jefferson’s decision to repeal all direct taxes
the presence of separatists within the Republican Party
Jefferson’s decision to slash military spending

answer_3.response: Jefferson’s extensive reforms for federal courts led to division within the Republican Party. Neither Marbury’s defeat nor repeal of the Judiciary Act placated extreme Republicans. They insisted that federal judges be made more responsive to the will of the people. One solution, short of electing federal judges, was impeachment. This clumsy device enabled the legislature to remove particularly offensive officeholders.
